result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Brellenthin.

Defendant Christopher J Bluhm in court with Attorney Mark A. Brellenthin.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #16CF774.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.  Sent to Judge Carter for review.
10/19/16,   Per Judge Carter: File.
Hearing on November 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher J Bluhm in court with attorney Mark A. Brellenthin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brellenthin requests another hearing date to receive response from the DA regarding consolidated offer.   The Attorney advises the Court they have received discovery.  The Attorney to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Court addresses WCS report.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Hearing on October 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Christopher J Bluhm in court with attorney Mark A. Brellenthin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Signed by CC Saafir on 07/19/16. Defendant to pay: $100/month on commencing on 08/01/16.

Defendant Christopher J Bluhm in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has the application for court appointed attorney and provides it to the court.  Court reviews the application on the record.  Court approves the application for court appointed attorney.  Court will order repayment at $100.00/month with the first payment being due on 8/01/2016 and each payment due the same date every month thereafter until paid in full.  Time limits previously tolled. Court will adjourn for status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Christopher J Bluhm in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he is not eligible for public defender representation.  Court addresses letter from WCS.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 7/5/2016 received and filed.
Hearing on July 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Christopher J Bluhm in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Motion to forfeit bail granted.
